name: Kates WiRD Box
description: That's right. No R&D interface. WiRD is your R&D search. With WiRD in play you can keep a solid track of what's your opponent is drawing and where its best to run. If your opponent leaves the agenda in R&D run it. If they draw it run HQ, that's why there's 2 HQ interface. The corp can't make a right choice. I'm debating dropping the fairie for an imp just to trash annoying cards but I think the early pressure it gives me while I find a dagger and cloak or two is worth it. DMC and toolbox are great for the extra MU and link. This deck needs the MU and I never regret the link. Nothing like saying "5" when asked what your current link str is. :) That 5 link kept a sea source worthless in one game. The midseasons rep still cost me all my money but I got rid of the 2 tags next turn with a MO in play. I'm still wanting to get my third WiRD back in though.

name: The New Flatline 1.0
description:
Toying around with some new Corp cards, trying to find a fresh way to flatline. Got a few points I've come up with, since I haven't playtested this yet:

Mushin no Shin is classy as heck. Work compression, economy and mind-game, all in one card. Props for Mushin-ing a GRNDL Refinery and getting away with it.

Chairman Hiro sits perfectly in Jinteki : PE. Always rez him after the runner's last click.

Pack Clone Retirements for Archers and Fenrises. They're your get-out-of-jail cards and more.

Also, Fenris is a thing of beauty. RAWR!

I'll be replacing Pri-Req with The Future Perfect, IF it's worth it and once it's actually spoiled.

Thoughts, people? :)

name: Virus v3.0
description:
[1] Rush Djinn with Diesel and Self-Modifying Code.

[2] Use Djinn to pump out viruses. Control R&D with medium.

[3] Kill ice with parasite + data suckers + wyrm.

[4] Rinse and repeat parasites with Deja Vu.

[5] Clean-up archives after you've played enough viruses; bound to have 1-2 agendas.

name: Peace Lilly
description: this deck does what gabe does well, setup fast and run cheap. with also the opportunity to build with kati jones and then drop rd interfaces and start hammering RD by surprise to get the last agenda points to win.

name: Silhouette Exposure
description: Blackguard + Expose to control the corp economy. As soon as you know what every card is, you can always force the corp to rez a card tht you don't want to access, keeping the corp broke as you acess central servers. Ninja was added for remote servers and Levy for a reset on long games. Emergency Shutdown and Crescentus is awesome so you can expose the same card again.
